title: Here's a list of 20 articles up to 2022 that delve into various aspects of meaning representation in natural languages
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** by Jacob Devlin et al
**"Attention is All You Need"** by Ashish Vaswani et al
**"Universal Dependencies: A Cross-Linguistic Perspective on Grammar and Lexicon"** by Joakim Nivre et al
**"A Neural Probabilistic Language Model"** by Yoshua Bengio et al
**"Word2Vec Explained: Deriving Mikolov et al.'s Negative-Sampling Word-Embedding Method"** by Yoav Goldberg and Omer Levy
**"GloVe: Global Vectors for Word Representation"** by Jeffrey Pennington

author.given: Deep Contextualized Word Representations" by Matthew E.Peters

title: **"The Stanford Typed Dependencies Representation"** by Marie-Catherine de Marneffe and Christopher D
**"Dependency-Based Word Embeddings"** by Omer Levy and Yoav Goldberg
**"Semantic Parsing on Freebase from Question-Answer Pairs"** by Jonathan Berant et al
**"Learning Phrase Representations using RNN Encoder-Decoder for Statistical Machine Translation"** by Kyunghyun Cho et al
**"A Structured Self-attentive Sentence Embedding"** by Zhouhan Lin et al
**"Natural Language Inference from Multiple Premises"** by Samuel R
**"The Role of Syntax in Vector Space Models of Compositional Semantics"** by Edward Grefenstette and Mehrnoosh Sadrzadeh
**"Neural Machine Translation by Jointly Learning to Align and Translate"** by Dzmitry Bahdanau
**"A Survey on Contextual Embeddings"** by Anna Rogers, Olga Kovaleva, and Anna Rumshisky
**"The Structure of the Lexicon: Incorporating Semantics and Pragmatics in Lexical Representations"** by Katrin Erk
**"Learning Word Vectors for Sentiment Analysis"** by Andrew L
**"The Representation of Meaning in Memory"** by Walter Kintsch
These articles cover a range of topics from foundational theories and models to recent advances in neural network-based approaches to meaning representation in natural languages
